name: 蔡銘修
objective: This course helps the learners recognize the syntax, style, and organization as far as the papers on English writings are concerned.
schedule:
01 02/24 Intro(research topic)
02 03/03 Endnote and Turnitin (bring your own laptop)
03 03/10 Research- Abstract
04 03/17 Research Method 1(online course)
05 03/24 Research- Introduction 1
06 03/31 Research- Introduction 2
07 04/07 No Class
08 04/14 Research- Literature Review & Introduction Practice
09 04/21 Midterm Week
10 04/28 Definition of terms
11 05/05 Research- Method 2
12 05/12 Research Result 
13 05/19 Research Discussion, Conclusion and Suggest(online course: https://meet.google.com/xtf-jfng-qgj)
14 05/26 Final Presentation Preparation
15 06/02 Conference(No Class)
16 06/09 Final Presentation(12 mins per student)
17 06/16 Writing for Final Paper
18 06/23 Final Exam Week (final paper due)
scorePolicy:
Grading:
1. Attendance 15%
2. Abstract 20%  
3. Final Presentation 25%
4. Final Research Paper 40% 
    - 12 font, 1.5 spaces
    - suggest full paper (7 pages)
5. Additional grade 5% (papers are accepted in International journal or conference)
materials:
Academic Writing for Graduate Students 3/e
Author: John M. Swales, & Christine B. Feak
Publisher: Michigan Press
Publication date: 2013/3
